TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in LOC .
On DATE the applicant brought proceedings against a local authority alleging that the authority had not ensured a good upkeep of his house .
On DATE the ORG refused to initiate the proceedings because the applicant had not paid a court fee .
On DATE the ORG quashed this decision on appeal as insufficiently reasoned .
On DATE the ORG again demanded the applicant to accompany his action with a court fee .
On DATE ORG upheld this decision on appeal .
On an unspecified date the applicant lodged a supervisory - review complaint against these decisions .
On DATE a judge of ORG refused to lodge an application for supervisory review .
On DATE the acting President of ORG upheld the decisions , including that of DATE .

On DATE a new Code of Civil Procedure ( “ CCivP ” ) was enacted to replace that of DATE . The ORG entered into force on DATE . LAW ORG defines the procedures by which judicial acts which have come into force may be re - examined . LAW defines the supervisory - review procedure :

“ CARDINAL . Judicial acts which have come into force ... may be appealed against ... in a supervisory - review court by parties to litigation and other persons if their rights and legal interests are affected by the judicial acts .
CARDINAL . Judicial acts may be appealed against in a supervisory - review court DATE after they come into force .

CARDINAL . Where a public prosecutor participated in litigation , officials of the prosecutor 's office ... shall have the right to appeal to a supervisory - review court against judicial acts which have come into force . ”
“ CARDINAL . A [ supervisory - review application ] against :
i ) ... a cassation judgment of ... a ORG ; ... a judgment of a ORG ... [ shall be brought ] before the ORG of a ... ORG ... ;
ii ) ... a cassation judgment of ... a ORG ; ... a judgment of a ORG ... [ shall be brought ] before ORG , if the ORG of a ... ORG has dismissed applications against these judgments ; ...

CARDINAL . [ Supervisory - review complaints ] against supervisory - review judgments of ORG of ORG ... shall be brought to the ORG of ORG if such judgments disrupt the unity of court jurisprudence . ”
“ CARDINAL . After examination of a [ supervisory - review application ] a judge shall decide as follows : either
i ) to obtain the case - file , if there are doubts as to the lawfulness of the judicial act ; or ,
ii ) not to obtain the case - file , if under the federal law the reasons of the [ supervisory - review application ] can not entail the quashing of the judicial act .

CARDINAL . NORP The President of the [ competent ] court may overrule the judge 's decision not to obtain the case - file . In this case the President of the relevant court ... shall give his own decision to obtain the case - file . ”
“ CARDINAL . After examination of the case obtained by the supervisory - review court a judge shall decide as follows : either
i ) not to pass the case for consideration on the merits by the supervisory - review court ; or ,
ii ) to pass the case for examination of the [ supervisory - review application ] by the supervisory - review court . ”

“ CARDINAL . NORP The President of the [ competent ] court may overrule the judge 's decision not to pass the case for consideration on the merits by the supervisory - review court . In this case the President of the relevant court ... shall give his own decision to pass the case for consideration on the merits by the supervisory - review court . ”

“ CARDINAL . The court hearing may be attended by parties to litigation , their counsel , other persons who have lodged the supervisory - review application ... if their rights and legal interests are directly affected by the judicial act appealed against ...
[ A representative of a prosecutor 's office ] may attend the hearing if a public prosecutor participated in the case .
CARDINAL . If the persons listed in p. CARDINAL of the present Article appear in the court hearing , they may make oral submissions on the case ... ”
“ The grounds for quashing or varying judicial acts of lower courts in supervisory - review proceedings shall be significant violations of substantive or procedural law . ”
“ The President or a Deputy President of ORG may lodge with the ORG of ORG a reasoned application for supervisory - review of judicial acts to ensure the unity of court jurisprudence and legality . ”
“ CARDINAL . After examination of a case under the supervisory - review procedure , a court may :
i ) uphold the decision of the court of first , second or supervisory - review instance and dismiss the [ supervisory - review application ] ;
ii ) quash the decision of the court of first , second or supervisory - review instance in full or in part and remit the case for a fresh examination ;
iii ) quash the decision of the court of first , second or supervisory - review instance in full or in part and shelve the case or close the proceedings ;
iv ) leave in force CARDINAL of judicial acts passed in the case ;

v ) quash or vary the decision of the court of first , second or supervisory - review instance and pass a new decision without remitting the case for a fresh examination if there has been a mistake in the application and interpretation of substantive law ... ”
